concise_definition: n. 预览, 预看; v. 预览, 预先观看

definitions.explanation_en: A preliminary view or showing of something before its official release or public availability, often to generate interest or allow for feedback.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在某事物正式发布或向公众开放前的预先展示，通常用于引发兴趣或收集反馈。
definitions.example_en: The film studio held a preview for critics a week before the theatrical release.
definitions.example_cn: 电影公司提前一周为影评人举办了首映预览。

definitions.explanation_en: To view or examine something in advance, especially to assess its content, quality, or suitability before final use or publication.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在最终使用或发布前预先查看或检查某物，以评估其内容、质量或适用性。
definitions.example_en: Please preview the document before printing to avoid formatting errors.
definitions.example_cn: 请在打印前预览文档，以避免格式错误。

definitions.explanation_en: To show or present something to an audience before its official release, especially in the context of media or entertainment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在官方发布前向观众展示某物，尤其用于媒体或娱乐领域。
definitions.example_en: The streaming platform will preview the new season next Friday.
definitions.example_cn: 该流媒体平台将于下周五首播新一季的预览内容。

comparison.analysis: “Preview” 强调在正式发布前的“预先观看”或“预览”，通常具有展示、评估或宣传的目的。它适用于媒体、软件、出版物等场景，带有明确的“提前性”和“非最终性”。
